page.title: 10HIGHGATE GREYHOUND TRACK
page.content: The track is at{Highgate}on Thurnscoe Road. Greyhound racing first started at{Manchester}where a track was built in the period between{1931-32.} The present track nowadays is wet sand but it used to be turf. However turf made the time slower. Greyhounds used to chase an{electric {hare}a bit like a teddy and sometimes still do but it never lasts more than one meeting and it was too expensive. So now a plastic bag is sometimes used. The track is open at 6.30p.m. on Monday and Thursdays. and on Sundays there are trials at 11.00 a.m. { Greyhounds are handicapped}according to the times they run. The Stadium usually has{600 Spectators}watching but 2000 approximately would fit in the Stadium. There is a public bar where you can go and have a drink.
